content:
There are a number of ways that universities ensure that their staff and students are aware of policies and procedures related to sexual assault or misconduct:

1. Orientation and training sessions: Universities offer orientation sessions for new students and staff that highlight campus policies and procedures related to sexual assault or misconduct.

2. Awareness campaigns: Universities run awareness campaigns that inform students and staff about behaviors that constitute sexual assault or misconduct and highlight the support services available to survivors.

3. Online Resources: Many universities have online resource that provide information and support to victims of sexual misconduct, These resources will have information on what constitutes sexual assault or misconduct, how to report it, and what support services are available.

4. Annual Awareness Programs: Many universities organize annual programs to increase awareness of issues around sexual misconduct. These programs can include lectures, workshops, panel discussions, film screenings, and more.

5. Professional Training: Universities provide training programs related to sexual misconduct for all faculty and staff. This is aimed to further educate the campus community about sexual misconduct, and better prepare them to prevent or respond to incidents.

By providing multilayered orientation, awareness campaigns, online resources, annual programs, and professional training, universities can help to ensure that their students and faculty are well-equipped to prevent and respond to incidents of sexual assault or misconduct.
